devdoc.details: Articles are not addressed with their identifiers. That enables us to reuse same storage address for another article later. Arbitrator is fixed, but subcourts, jury size and metaevidence are not. We prevent articles to get withdrawn immediately. This is to prevent submitter to escape punishment in case someone discovers an argument to debunk the article. Bounty amounts are compressed with a lossy compression method to save on storage cost.

challenge(uint80).details: withdrawalPermittedAt has some special values: 0 indicates withdrawal possible but process not started yet, max value indicates there is a challenge and during challenge it's forbidden to start another challenge.

params._articleStorageAddress: The address of the article in the storage.

params._disputeID: The dispute ID as in the arbitrator.
params._supportedRuling: The supported ruling in this funding.

params._articleStorageAddress: The address of the article in the storage.

params._articleID: Unique identifier of an article. Usually an IPFS content identifier.
params._category: Article category. This changes which metaevidence will be used.
params._searchPointer: Starting point of the search. Find a vacant storage slot before calling this function to minimize gas cost.

initiateWithdrawal(uint80).details: withdrawalPermittedAt has some special values: 0 indicates withdrawal possible but process not started yet, max value indicates there is a challenge and during challenge it's forbidden to start withdrawal process.

params._articleStorageAddress: The address of the article in the storage.

params._arbitratorExtraData: Extra data of Kleros arbitrator, signaling subcourt and jury size selection.

params._disputeID: The dispute ID as in the arbitrator.

params._evidenceURI: IPFS content identifier of the evidence.

withdraw(uint80).details: withdrawalPermittedAt has some special values: 0 indicates withdrawal possible but process not started yet, max value indicates there is a challenge and during challenge it's forbidden to start withdrawal process.

params._articleStorageAddress: The address of the article in the storage.

params._contributor: The address whose rewards to withdraw.
params._disputeID: ID of the dispute as in arbitrator.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.
params._ruling: Ruling that received contribution from contributor.

returns.amount: The amount available to withdraw for given question, contributor, round number and ruling option.

params._contributor: The address whose rewards to withdraw.
params._disputeID: ID of the dispute as in arbitrator.
params._ruling: Ruling that received contributions from contributor.

devdoc.title: The Trust Post

appealFee(uint256).notice: Returns the total amount needs to be paid to appeal a dispute.

buyAndBurn().notice: TODO. This function should use treasuryBalance to buy a token and send it to 0x0.

challenge(uint80).notice: Challenges the article at the given storage address. Follow events to find out which article resides in which slot.

challengeFee(uint80).notice: Returns the total amount needs to be paid to challenge an article.

changeAdmin(address).notice: Lets you to transfer ownership of an article. This is useful when you want to change owner account without withdrawing and resubmitting.

findVacantStorageSlot(uint80).notice: Helper function to find a vacant slot for article. Use this function before calling initialize to minimize your gas cost.

fundAppeal(uint256,uint8).notice: Lets you fund a crowdfunded appeal. In case of funding is incomplete, you will be refunded. Withdrawal will be carried out using withdrawFeesAndRewards function.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.notice: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount. This function has O(m) time complexity where m is number of rounds. It is safe to assume m is always less than 10 as appeal cost growth order is O(m^2).

increaseBounty(uint80).notice: Lets you increase a bounty of a live article.

initiateWithdrawal(uint80).notice: Lets a author to start withdrawal process.

rule(uint256,uint256).notice: For arbitrator to call, to execute it's ruling. In case arbitrator rules in favor of challenger, challenger wins the bounty. In any case, withdrawalPermittedAt will be reset.

submitEvidence(uint256,string).notice: Lets you submit evidence as defined in evidence (ERC-1497) standard.

transferOwnership(uint80,address).notice: Lets you to transfer ownership of an article. This is useful when you want to change owner account without withdrawing and resubmitting.

updateChallengeTaxRate(uint256).notice: Lets you to transfer ownership of an article. This is useful when you want to change owner account without withdrawing and resubmitting.

withdraw(uint80).notice: Executes a withdrawal. Can only be executed by author.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,u.notice: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint2.notice: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For all rounds at once. This function has O(m) time complexity where m is number of rounds. It is safe to assume m is always less than 10 as appeal cost growth order is O(2^m).

userdoc.notice: Smart contract for a type of curation, where submitted items are on hold until they are withdrawn and the amount of security deposits are determined by submitters.
